channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024040881
item.description:
Report X-2024040881

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: KINGSPORT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package discovered 2 days after damage event and found to be improperly repacked. Upon inspection of repacked contents, the volume on one plastic jug of all purpose cleaner is lower than the other three. Based on prior experience, it is concluded that this one jug had a loose cap which allowed leaking. It then caused the outer box to mottle and corrode. Cap is found to be on tightly inside repack box. No further leaking observed. DescribePack: Unable to comply. Package was improperly repacked and no Hazmat Damage reporting was conducted at the time of the incident. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Cap tightened. All caps double checked for secure closure.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 6th a package was discovered during the PM sort. The package was marked as UN3090 Lithium Metal Batteries, 9, however the package was destroyed during shipping. The batteries that were inside the package were not damaged. The package was placed into a salvage drum and is pending disposition.

DescribePack: Package failed due to bottom of pail cracking causing contents to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package mitigation consisted of putting package in an open content bin and leaving it for OB QA to process.

item.title: Report X-2024040780
item.description:
Report X-2024040780

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: It has been brought to our attention that a package was found to be leaking at the unload side. As a precautionary measure, the package was immediately placed in a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred to a red tote. The red tote was then transported to the Quality Assurance (QA) cage for further examination. DescribePack: A package was discovered to be leaking at the unloading area. Upon inspection, it was determined that one out of four one-gallon bottles had a loose cap, resulting in the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon the discovery of the package's leakage, it was promptly secured within a hazardous bag and subsequently transferred into a red tote to mitigate any potential for additional spillage.

item.title: Report X-2024040614
item.description:
Report X-2024040614

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-06
  • City: CLARKSVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking by driver when he was going to load the package. QA called PDM Kayla Hoback to inspect package after seeing it was a HazMat. Kayla put PPE on and moved package to hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: Upon inspection, the package was found with a small leak appearing to be coming from one of the gallons of corrosive liquid. It appears that one of the caps failed and allowed it to leak. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately segregated and put in HazMat cage for processing.

Gloves were worn while handling and cleaning the spillage. Most spillage was contained in the outer carton.

item.title: Report X-2024040708
item.description:
Report X-2024040708

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Conductor reported strong smell of sulfur in the area near the car. Car isolated. Contractor called to respond with H2S meter. Investigation revealed leakage around the manwy cover. Manway was opened and contractor found shipper had placed several gaskets on top of each other, rather than removing the old gaskets. Contractor removed old gaskets and found the original flat gasket still in the manway cover. This gasket was used to seal the car. Once manway bolts tightened, there was no detect on the meter around the manway.

item.title: Report E-2024040346
item.description:
Report E-2024040346

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 5, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of hypochlorite solution had a faulty valve and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted site. E3 personnel utilized absorbent pads and neutralized the impacted-dock floor. The new tote of product was properly labeled and staged onsite for further transport. The damaged 275-gallon tote was deconstructed and placed into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. All debris and generated waste were collected and containerized into the same one (1) 55-gallon poly drum with the deconstructed tote.

Package was promptly placed into a tote and transferred to the hazmat cage for further inspection. DescribePack: The package was wet and leaking. One of the bottles had the seams under the neck of the bottle separated which resulted in a minor leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

The tote was than transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: There were small wet catches at the top of the box. One of the bottles had a loosened cap that resulted in a minor leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional chance for leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024040565
item.description:
Report X-2024040565

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: KINGSPORT
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by P&D Manger Jon Gabriel who notified Ops Supervisor Nate Perry. When I arrived to the scene, i found a box leaking white powder like substance. Upon further inspection I found a 5 gallon bucket inside of a box that was busted and had leaked most of the contents out of the bucket into the box. DescribePack: There was a major crack down the side of the bucket and busted at the bottom of the sidewall. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was swiftly taken to the hazmat processing area and was transferred into a lined salvage drum.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat spill. Fiberboard box leaking granules found in lined tote on HMPA staging pallet. No Op-951 found; prior events unknown. DescribePack: One 50lb plastic drum lost 4lb of granules from a crack on the bottom edge of the drum, covering 25% of the diameter but not following a seam. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2024040465

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat, undeclared, spill incident. No DOT labels, UN number, or Proper Shipping Name found on outside of package. Leaking fiberboard box found in lined tote on HMPA staging pallet. No OP-951; no prior events known. DescribePack: One of twelve 1 quart plastic bottles lost 0.2 quart of fluid from a failed safety seal below the cap closure. All contents mildly soiled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2024040435

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brough to our attention after acknowledging the wet stains on the surface. Package was placed into a plastic bag and then into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage. Tote was then transferred to the HazMat station for further inspection. DescribePack: One of the four 1-gallon bottles had a loosened cap that resulted in a leakage. The box itself was nearly soaked in the corrosive liquid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a plastic bag and then into a tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon the discovery of the pail, it was placed into a plastic bag and into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage. The tote was then transferred to the hazmat cage for additional inspection. DescribePack: There was a small puncture like opening at the bottom of the cylinder which resulted in a leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pail was placed into a plastic bag and then into a plastic tote to mitigate any additional spillage.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fully regulated hazmat in fiberboard box found on HMPA staging pallet in a lined tote. No OP-951; prior events unknown. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles of Amco 121 Liquid Soldering Flux lost 0.3 gallons due to a loose cap closure. All bottles soiled, despite presence of slotted partitions. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used. Tote lined with hazbag.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being loaded and ended up tilted on its side allowing the loose cap to come off and the liquid contents to spill out. QA was immediately called, and the spill was contained. DescribePack: Cap on jug of cleaning solution completely off. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: shipping container was immediately placed upright and into a tote. The spilled cleaning solution was cleaned up.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The leaking package was removed from sort, placed in a tote, and brought to the HMPA for processing. No other information is available. DescribePack: The four bottles all leaked at the caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The carton was placed in a tote. The package was placed in front of the exhaust hood and PPE was worn while processing. The spillage was confined to the carton.
